item.title: Katherine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Olive Ann Burns
item.description: "But to mourn, that's different. To mourn is to be eaten alive with homesickness for the person." -- Olive Ann Burns

item.title: Katherine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katherine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Imagine yourself as a living house. God comes in to rebuild that house. At first, perhaps, you can understand what He is doing. He is getting the drains right and stopping the leaks in the roof and so on; you knew that those jobs needed doing and so you are not surprised. But presently He starts knocking the house about in a way that hurts abominably and does not seem to make any sense. What on earth is He up to? The explanation is that He is building quite a different house from the one you thought of - throwing out a new wing here, putting on an extra floor there, running up towers, making courtyards. You thought you were being made into a decent little cottage: but He is building a palace. He intends to come and live in it Himself." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katherine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I can't imagine a man really enjoying a book and reading it only once." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katherine add a quote by John Donne
item.description: "Be thine own palace, or the world's thy jail." -- John Donne

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Michael J. Sullivan
item.description: "Sometimes the price of dreams is achieving them." -- Michael J. Sullivan

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Michael J. Sullivan
item.description: "If this hast been done to language, I fear to know the fate of all else." -- Michael J. Sullivan

item.title: Katherine add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Katherine add a quote by David McCullough
item.description: "Adams was both a devout Christian and an independent thinker, and he saw no conflict in that." -- David McCullough

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "So you’re saying that I could die at any moment!” “Yes. And this is different from your life yesterday in what way?" -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "The gods do not grant miracles for our purposes, but for theirs. If you are become their tool, it is for a greater reason, an urgent reason. But you are the tool. You are not the work." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Katherine add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: " I have measured out my life with coffee spoons;" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Mary Jane Hathaway
item.description: "I don’t correct anyone’s grammar unless they’re under five." -- Mary Jane Hathaway

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Anya Seton
item.description: "The knights were disgusted. They said that all that fiddle-faddle was well enough for saints, or might have been a thousand years ago, but the Lord Jesus would certainly be the first to command Christians to kill pagans. Rumon announced that he did not think so." -- Anya Seton

item.title: Katherine add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Han is only in it for the money, he makes that plain right from the start … which makes it all the more thrilling when he returns at the end of Star Wars to put that rocket up Darth Vader’s butt. (Oh, and he DOES shoot first in the cantina scene, no matter how George Lucas retcons that first movie.)" -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Katherine add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Maybe it’s the rogue in me, the part of me that loves to color outside the lines, but the truth is, I don’t have much respect for genre barriers." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Katherine add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "publishing has changed, chain bookstores have multiplied, the genre barriers have hardened. I think that’s a pity. Books should broaden us, take us to places we have never been and show us things we’ve never seen, expand our horizons and our way of looking at the world. Limiting your reading to a single genre defeats that. It limits us, makes us smaller. It seemed to me, then as now, that there were good stories and bad stories, and that was the only distinction that truly mattered. We think we have some good ones here." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Anthony Ryan
item.description: "It was a curious effect of pain that time became infinite, every instant of agony prolonged to the ultimate." -- Anthony Ryan
